intro: Artabotrys brachypetalus, commonly known as the narrow-petaled satinflower, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Annonaceae family, known for its fragrant, showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that emit a sweet, intoxicating scent. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a glossy appearance. Artabotrys brachypetalus is typically found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
